messages.content: What natural language is most suitable for fast spoken communication?

There is no single natural language that is most suitable for fast spoken communication. Different languages have different syntax and grammar rules, which can make them difficult or easy to understand for people with different levels of proficiency in the language. However, some languages are known for being easier to understand for speakers of other languages than others. For example, languages that are known for being relatively simple and have a short word length, such as Japanese and Korean, may be more suitable for fast spoken communication. Ultimately, the most suitable language for fast spoken communication will depend on the needs and preferences of the individual or group communicating.
Assuming two native speakers are using the language, which language would be most economic?

There is no one "best" language for communication in terms of being economic. The level of economic efficiency of a language will depend on the specific context and the needs of the individuals communicating. For example, if two native speakers are communicating in a business setting, one language may be more economic than the other depending on the specific terms and concepts of the business. One language may be more efficient for expressing information and ideas, while the other language may be more efficient for expressing financial transactions or contracts. Ultimately, the most economic language will depend on the specific needs and preferences of the individuals communicating and the context in which they are communicating.
